values: I recently made all my FOB fan fiction private, because the band is doing an event on January 8 in which they intend to make a video of them reading fan fiction. That makes me very uncomfortable, and I don't want any of my work used. So it will all stayed locked until the event is over. If you're interested in reading one of my stories, check back after then.

My dear Yuletide Writer, Thank you for writing for me! I'm very excited about all the fandoms I requested. You have great taste for offering one of them. :) Here's some general stuff about my story preferences: I have a very broad range of enjoyment when it comes to stories. I like slash, het and gen. I'm into reading explicit sex if you're into writing it, but all ratings are good. I love relationship stories that show the deepening sense of intimacy between two people, whether it's a romance or a friendship. I also adore plotty stories, casefiles, action/adventure, future fic, backstory, and my great love for fan fiction cliches never dies! I don't mind some angst in a story, especially if the source material really calls for it, but I do appreciate when a story ends on a hopeful note. A few things I'm not really into are: Non-con (although I don't mind dub con), crossovers, and gore. Guardians of the Galaxy (Movies): Gamora, Peter Quill, Rocket, Groot Found family is one of my favorite themes, and it's my favorite part of this movie. I would love a story that explores what happens after the movie ends, how the team settles in together, how their friendships develop, the adventures and misadventures they have. I could only choose four characters, but team fic is what I crave, so if you're cool with including Drax, I'd totally enjoy it. But it's also cool if you don't! I'm particularly fond of Gamora-centered stories, but don't let that get in the way of your inspiration if you find you want to go in a different direction. Guardians gen fic is my happy place, so while I don't mind some angst and difficulty along the way, I would like the resolution of the story to be positive. Sebastian St. Cyr Mysteries - C. S. Harris: Sebastian St. Cyr, Hero Jarvis/Lady Devlin The relationship between Devlin and Hero is my favorite part of the book, and I'd love to read more of it from any point along its development. A missing scene from when they're first getting to know one another. The two of them at loggerheads pursuing their own agendas. A moment from their marriage. I love case files, and if you want to write one, I'd adore reading it. Really anything that explores their relationship would be awesome. Those Who Kill: Catherine Jensen, Thomas Schaeffer I watched this show for the amazing chemistry between these two characters, for the way their issues dovetailed in such a fascinating, train-wreck kind of way. I was very sorry that the series ended with such a cliffhanger, and I'd love a story that tackles what happened next. Or a missing scene from any point during the series. I can see their relationship turning sexual, and if you want to explore that, I'd happily read it. But I'm also interested in how they work together, how they connect as people, and I'd happily read a gen characterization as well. It's a dark show, and I'm fine with a dark story if that's where inspiration takes you. Wonderfalls: Jaye Tyler, Eric Gotts I rewatched this show recently, and I was struck all over again by how charming the relationship is between Jaye and Eric. I'd love a story in which Eric gets pulled along on one of Jaye's missions, and they have (mis)adventures together. Or a story that shows what happened next after the show left off. Or how Eric finds out about Jaye's talking animal issue. I'm imagining a more lighthearted story in keeping with the show's tone, but if you feel like getting serious, that would be interesting too!

As seen on Tumblr...but I think it will be more fun to do here!

1) Give me a pairing.

2) Give me an AU setting.

3) I will write you a three-sentence fic.

ETA: By three-sentence fic I mean: something relatively short. :)

My dear friend posted the link to this video that has become MY NEW FAVORITE THING. Luscious Jackson - #1 Bum I LOVE these women and their reactions, and I have had this very conversation with fangirls SO MANY TIMES. In fat, my Yankees friends and I have a hand gesture that's shorthand for: "Derek Jeter's ass is perfect." No words necessary. Message perfectly understood. Now I really, REALLY need a hockey vid set to this song. Please?

I saw this really fun Halloween thing from and , and decided to join in. In honor of All Hallow's Eve, I'm inviting trick-or-treaters to my "door." Comment "trick-or-treat" to this post and...well, you know the drill. Treats can be anything that strikes my fancy (pics of fave actors or pairings, one sentence fics, graphics, a few words why I'm glad to have you on my flist, etc. etc.). The more "houses" to visit the more fun it'll be, so go ahead, open your journal and help spread the fun!

My dear Yuletide Writer, Thank you for writing for me! I'm very excited about all the fandoms I requested. You have great taste for offering one of them. :) I have a very broad range of enjoyment when it comes to stories. I like slash, het and gen. I'm into reading explicit sex if you're into writing it, but all ratings are good. I love relationship stories that show the deepening sense of intimacy between two people, whether it's a romance or a friendship. I also adore plotty stories, casefiles, action/adventure, future fic, backstory, and my great love for fan fiction cliches never dies! I don't mind some angst in a story, especially if the source material really calls for it, but I do appreciate when a story ends on a hopeful note. A few things I'm not really into are: Non-con (although I don't mind dub con), crossovers, and graphic violence. Woman on the Edge of Time, Connie, Bee, Jackrabbit, Luciente (or really any characters) This is one of my favorite books, and I'd be thrilled to get any story set in this universe. I'd love to see Connie become more involved with the people of the future or read a missing scene of life in Mattapoisett. I'd be happy with gen or if you'd like to write an erotic story, I'm always good with that. I've wondered what it would have been like if Connie had taken Jackrabbit up on his flirtation. Actually, I'd love to read any permutation of Connie, Bee, Jackrabbit and Luciente. All the characters in this universe are awesome, so please feel free to include any that you wish. Really, anything you want to explore will make my day. Haven, Audrey Parker, Nathan Wuornos, Duke Crocker This is a show I look forward to every week, and there are so many different kinds of stories I'd enjoy reading. A resolution of the big issue in S4. A casefile set anywhere in the timeline that has Nathan, Audrey and Duke working together. Something romantic and relationship focused. I enjoy any combination of the characters but tend most toward OT3 or Duke/Nathan. I'm intrigued by the show's mythology and the glimpses we get of Audrey's origins, and I'd love to read a take on that. I'd also enjoy future fic that shows life after the Troubles. The one thing I'd prefer not to see is a complete AU since the world of Haven is so interesting and shapes the characters so much. Ripper Street, Edmund Reid, Homer Jackson I find the relationship between these two completely fascinating. It's hard for me to resist the upright man of the law and the shady neer-do-well finding common ground, working together and coming to respect one another. I would happily read slash, but if that isn't your cup of tea, I would equally as happily read about their working relationship or burgeoning friendship. If you like to write casefiles, I'd adore one of those. Or perhaps one of the men has to help the other out of a jam. Or there's some awkward advice asking about personal matters. Really, anything that portrays the connection between these two will be awesome. Sense and Sensibility (1995), Margaret Dashwood I rewatched this movie recently and was struck by how winning young Margaret is (a rather different characterization than in the book). I would love future fic that follows her adventures. What is she like as a young woman? Does she ever get to see the Nile? If you want to write the story of Margaret finding love as her sisters did before her, that would be lovely. If writing future fic isn't really your thing, then Margaret's take on the events of the movie would also be delightful. L.A. Confidential, Bud White, Ed Exley These two never stop being hot no matter how many times I watch the movie. If you're into writing slash, I would love slash for them, and if filthy, dirty porn is your thing, hey, it's my thing too. I've always thought Lynn saying "Fucking me and fucking Bud White aren't the same thing" is one of the most deliciously provocative lines ever, and if you'd like to do something with that, awesome. However, if you're not comfortable writing Ed and Bud in a sexual relationship, I would also love a portrayal of their working relationship and growing friendship. I'd adore future fic where they're reunited to work a case together or a missing scene from the movie that sheds light on their respective personalities and what draws them together. Elementary, Joan Watson, Sherlock Holmes I'd adore a Joan-centric story and especially one that shows her really coming into her own as a detective. Maybe she notices something that Sherlock missed or uses her knowledge as a doctor to solve a case. Or if you're not into writing casefiles, I'd love insight into Joan's thoughts about her change of career, how she feels about being a detective, where she imagines the future taking her. I also love the relationship between Joan and Sherlock, and if you'd like to focus on it, that would be awesome as well. While I hope the show always keeps things platonic between them, I'm open to a bit of romance in fanfic. ETA: I forgot the most important thing of all! Which is that my suggestions are just that...suggestions. Write the story that makes you happy, and I'm sure it will make me happy too.

I've never had a problem with ants before, but recently they invaded my kitchen. I found where they were coming in around the window and sealed it up, but apparently hordes had already made it inside. I never store food unsealed, and I've been even more scrupulous about keeping all dishes washed and the counters scrubbed down. I also tried rubbing down the counters with peppermint oil which is supposed to deter them. I keep thinking they're gone and then finding more. Any tips? I really want these things out of my house.

Thanks to everyone who shared the TV shows they're looking forward to this fall! I think I've now sorted out my fall TV viewing. Returning shows I'm really excited about: -Elementary: my favorite show on TV right now -Person of Internet: the end of last season left the story in a fascinating place, can't wait to see what happens next -Haven: OT3! OT3! Other returning shows I'll probably be watching: -Castle: I love Nathan Fillion, but enough already with the OTT relationship drama -Criminal Minds: This show jumped the shark for me last season, but a formulaic crime drama can be so weirdly soothing Dear-God-why-can't-I-quit-you shows that maybe this year I will actually quit: -Mentalist: F*ck you, just tell us who Red John is already, although I seriously don't know why I even care -Supernatural: This show really should have ended several seasons ago, but I enjoyed this past season pretty well, so I probably won't quit it unless it's just too mired in Winchester misery New shows I'm giving a shot: -Agents of S.H.E.I.L.D: Big shock I know! -Sleepy Hollow: HEADS. WILL. ROLL. This looks ridiculous in the most delightful way. -The Blacklist: If this show didn't have James Spader in it I would probably pass, but it does, so. -Reign: What can I say? I enjoy overwrought historical dramas. -Dracula: I can't tell if this looks interesting or just pretentious, but I'm going to tune in and find out.

I found this fantastic Women's Hockey Primer put together by pineapplechild via Tumblr. If there is anything more awesome than women playing hockey I don't know what it is. Also, I may have fallen in love with the captain of the US women's team, Julie Chu, a little bit. Or, you know, kind of a lot.

I truly can't believe that September is almost here. Where did the summer go? No, no, really, where did 2013 go? I feel like I slept through it. But, hey, September does mean that Yuletide nominations are on the horizon. And this year...I have no idea what to nominate. Hm. There is this vague memory I have of saying at least once or maybe more than that during the year...hey, I have to remember that for Yuletide! Oops. Relying on my memory is always a bad plan. I could ask for Ripper Street, because there is so very, very little fandom for it, and Captain Jackson is a sexy, unwashed scoundrel. Of course I do always nominate Woman On The Edge of Time, and I still haven't completely despaired of receiving it one day. I don't think hockey RPF is eligible? Or maybe it depends on the pairing. What else do I like? I can't think. So what are you guys nominating?

Passing along two links today (and completely glossing over the fact that I forgot to post yesterday, oops): 1. Transformation and Transcendence: The Power of Female Friendship by Emily Rapp It's an article from last January, a meditation piece on how female friendship is generally treated in the mainstream media (dismissive and denigrating) versus the reality of how strong and nurturing and important these ties so often are. Female friendship plays a really important role in my life, and it was lovely to read a celebration of it. 2. Hockeyfact podcast Maybe everyone else already knows about this hockey podcast, but I just found out about it recently. And it's awesome! There can never be enough of fangirls talking about hockey. Two episodes are available so far, with a mix of hockey news, opinions, and fannish happenings. Check it out!

4,000 hits. Wow. Just wow. What an amazing accomplishment.

I have to admit, though, that I wasn't watching. I've been a bad Yankees fan this year. It's not that the team has been losing. It's that I don't even recognize them as my team. In pretty much every game, there's someone who comes up to bat or in to pitch, and I'm like: Who the hell is that? The most fun I had at the ballpark this year was at a Mets game watching Matt Harvey pitch. 

Is it hockey season yet?

I haven't watched much TV this summer. Teen Wolf came back on and I just...had no interest in tuning in. I caught one episode of Rizzoli and Isles, and I enjoyed it, but then I kept forgetting it was on. I have caught up on some British shows--Broadchurch, The Fall, Luthor--and I've been making use of my Amazon Prime free instant videos to watch many episodes of Trial and Retribution. 

Have there been any commercials for new fall shows? I can't remember any. Is it just me or has TV been largely disappointing the past few seasons? I mean, I adore Elementary, and I like POI very much. I watch Castle and sometimes enjoy it. I'm excited about new seasons of Ripper Street, Haven, and Whitechapel whenever they come along. I can't really think of anything else.

So what are you guys watching? What do you recommend? Are there any upcoming shows you're excited about?

One thing I do really enjoy about Tumblr is all the pictures of hot people and cute animals. Since I didn't have time today to put together part 2 of the Kaner/Tazer recs, here's an extremely adorable kitty pic instead. Cats! On shelves!

I finally got myself a tumblr. I'm scribblinlenore there as well. I still prefer DW/LJ as a platform for fannishness, but I don't want to be left behind. I'd love to find old friends over there. Let me know if you're on tumblr, so we can connect.

ETA: LOL! So I actually managed to type in my user name wrong when I created my tumblr account. Off to a great start! But it's fixed now, and you should be able to find me.

vanilla kink endurance bondage tattoos / tattooing mummification / immobilization
torture / interrogation bodily fluids wildcard animal play ageplay
leather / latex / rubber wet messy dirty consent play shaving / depilation bloodplay
temperature play chastity devices fucking machines breathplay prostitution / sex work
Last year I was all about Teen Wolf. This year I'm going to see what I can do with hockey. I've got my eye on the endurance, wet messy dirty, negotiation and consent play squares. I also want to look for ways to subvert kinks that really aren't to my taste. Seems like this is going to be it for kink_bingo for a while, so I want to really do it up.

My birthday is coming up in June, and I have this tradition that I hold my own personal smut-a-thon. I ask people to give me smutty prompts, and I write some porn. A very fun way to celebrate a birthday! So I'd like to do it again. If you have a prompt, hit me with it. Right now I'm really into Sid/Geno (that's hockey rpf), but I'll take prompts for any fandom I've ever written, any show I talk about on my LJ, or, really, anything you think I might be up for. This post will remain open for prompts until my b-day, 6/20. I'll see how many stories I can come up with before Gemini ends.

So...I seem to have fallen hopelessly under the spell of Sid and Geno. Does anyone want to discuss their awesomeness with me? (Because I probably shouldn't keep e-mailing pun every few seconds.) I mean...if there is anyone still on DW/LJ, that is. :)
My friends are very good to me! Now in addition to the Tazeer/Kaner primer posted by linaerys, there is also an awesome Sid/Geno primer posted by pun. I have so much great stuff to read. So happy!

If you're like me and have felt left out of all of the excitement over hockey fic but you don't actually want to bother to learn anything about hockey, you should check out this Tazer/Kaner primer that linaerys put together. It is awesome! http://linaerys.livejournal.com/888155.html Now I am off to start reading...

Um...was I hallucinating or did that actually happen on my TV screen? 

Oh. my. God.

I'll just be over at AO3 if you need me.

So...I had intended to post today about Ripper Street, because I have totally fallen for that show and feel that other people need to appreciate it's delightful slash-fest-ness, and I will still do that at a later time, BUT FIRST! I'm sure by now everyone knows that a Veronica Mars movie is well on its way to being fan funded on Kickstarter. Oh my God, I'm so excited I can't even. I've been hoping and pining for a movie since the show ended. I just rewatched the first season and was reminded of how absolutely amazing the show was with its razor sharp writing, fantastic acting, interesting characters and relationships, and a murder mystery that had me on the edge of my seat. MORE OF THIS PLEASE, YAY! I'm also just really excited to see how this is happening. I'm a populist at heart, and I love the great democratizing force of the Internet. The kinds of stories that get told in popular culture don't just reflect our society they shape it. Until the Internet, the decisions about what those stories would be were held in too few hands. The Internet lets us turn our voices into votes and our spare change into movies. This is an awesome day to be a person who cares about storytelling. ETA: GOAL REACHED!! IT IS FUNDED!

You guys, I have never defaulted on picfor1000, and I don't want to start. I like my picture, and yet I have absolutely no thoughts about it. Or at least I have no thoughts that lead to fic. http://www.flickr.com/photos/arjunpurky/2482517713/lightbox/ I mean, sure, it says Derek's days in Brooklyn, but I don't feel inspired by that. Any thoughts? Anybody? *is very grateful for your help*

Enough already with the million-billion TW stories where every character in it describes Derek as looking like a criminal or a serial killer the first time they lay eyes on him. He really, really doesn't. I mean, let's leave aside the fact that criminals don't have any particular look and actual serial killer Ted Bundy was described as clean-cut, charming and an all-around great guy by people who knew him. Derek Hale looks like an underwear model or an athlete or just a really hot guy with a surly temperament. I know the whole "he looks like a criminal" thing is hyperbole and supposed to be funny, but it's in EVERY story I read. And I'm so SICK of it. 

ARGH!!!

It feels like I haven't posted in a long while. I was sick, and then I got really busy, and now I have a bad case of February. All I want to do is huddle indoors and wait for spring. But some things have been going on... 1. Porn Battle I had a lot of ambition for this year's Porn Battle, but sadly little follow through. There were lots of great prompts, and I might still try to write some of the things I was considering. I did post this LA Confidential ficlet. I'd never thought about this pairing before, and when I saw the prompt, I was intrigued. Afterward (1154 words) by Lenore
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: L.A. Confidential (1997)
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Dubious consent
Relationships: Matt Reynolds/Jack Vincennes
Summary: Matt loses his nerve after all, and Jack finds a way to encourage him. 2. Podfic It makes my day that people still enjoy my Bandom stories even though I haven't written in that fandom for a couple of years. Check out the podfic that melusina made based on my Pete/Patrick story Frogs Out There Who Used To Be People. She makes both the Pete and Patrick voices wonderfully hilarious. 3. Cover art Also check out the hot, hot cover that Mari_McSly mad for my Teen Wolf story Howlin' For You. Stripper Derek...mmm, yum! 4. Picfor1000 I've done exactly zero work on my picfor1000 story even though I have the perfect Derek's-life-in-Brooklyn photo: http://www.flickr.com/photos/arjunpurky/2482517713/lightbox/

I made lemon curd from some of my (many) Meyer lemons. It came out right! And it's delicious! 

Recipe:
http://www.davidlebovitz.com/2009/12/improved-lemon-curd/

Okay, yes, it was actually easy. But I must celebrate every small culinary victory. Mm. I can't wait to have it on my toast for breakfast tomorrow. Yum!
My newfound love for Haven and its OT3 has inspired an original menage romance idea. However, I've never actually read any original menage romance. Does anyone have any recs?

I wrote two stories this year--Point Break and Haven--and had a ball! Zero Gravity (8207 words) by Lenore Chapters: 1/1 Fandom: Point Break (1991) Rating: Explicit Warning: No Archive Warnings Apply Relationships: Bodhi/Johnny Utah, Johnny Utah/Tyler Characters: Johnny Utah, Bodhi, Tyler, Angelo Pappas, Ben Harp Summary:

Three months and five days into the Clinton administration a package arrives on Johnny's doorstep. It contains a mask of the most recent ex-president, George H. W. Bush.

Melt (3230 words) by Lenore Chapters: 1/1 Fandom: Haven Rating: Explicit Warning: No Archive Warnings Apply Relationships: Duke Crocker/Nathan Wuornos Characters: Duke Crocker, Nathan Wuornos, Audrey Parker Summary:

Nathan tangles with a Troubled person who turns people to ice with her touch. Duke is the only thing keeping him from freezing to death.
My fannish new year has started out on a fantastic note. The wonderful hananobira created podfic inspired by my story Under Your Skin. You can find it at her DW or AO3. Yay!

I received an absolutely AMAZING story this year: The Age of Unfolding (10514 words) by Anonymous Chapters: 1/1 Fandom: Art of Fielding - Chad Harbach Rating: Teen And Up Audiences Warning: Major Character Death Relationships: Guert Affenlight/Owen Dunne, Pella Affenlight/Mike Schwartz, Owen Dunne/OMC Characters: Owen Dunne, Pella Affenlight, Mike Schwartz, Henry Skrimshander, Guert Affenlight, Adam Starblind Summary:

It's been twenty-five years since Owen graduated from Westish, but now he's being called back - to see old friends, play one more baseball game, and perhaps lay a few ghosts to rest.

Major spoilers for the entire book from the very beginning.

If you haven't read Art of Fielding, you should! Here's the Amazon blurb: At Westish College, a small school on the shore of Lake Michigan, baseball star Henry Skrimshander seems destined for big league stardom. But when a routine throw goes disastrously off course, the fates of five people are upended. Henry's fight against self-doubt threatens to ruin his future. College president Guert Affenlight, a longtime bachelor, has fallen unexpectedly and helplessly in love. Owen Dunne, Henry's gay roommate and teammate, becomes caught up in a dangerous affair. Mike Schwartz, the Harpooners' team captain and Henry's best friend, realizes he has guided Henry's career at the expense of his own. And Pella Affenlight, Guert's daughter, returns to Westish after escaping an ill-fated marriage, determined to start a new life. As the season counts down to its climactic final game, these five are forced to confront their deepest hopes, anxieties, and secrets. In the process they forge new bonds, and help one another find their true paths. Written with boundless intelligence and filled with the tenderness of youth, The Art of Fielding is an expansive, warmhearted novel about ambition and its limits, about family and friendship and love, and about commitment--to oneself and to others. I bought this book for the baseball and the gay relationship, and I loved it for the characters and their friendships. Here's what I requested for Yuletide: Owen is my favorite character in a novel filled with characters I love. What I'd truly adore is Owen future fic. What does his life look like in a year, five years, ten or twenty? Is he in love? How do his memories of Guert affect his relationships? Is he a scholar? Is he still in touch with his friends from college? What role does baseball play in his life? As I mentioned, I like all the characters in the novel, so please include any that you would like. If you want to tell me about the relationship Owen is in, I'd happily read about an original character. My amazing anon writer gave me ALL OF THAT in one brilliant package. It's beautifully imagined, impeccably written--in epistolary form no less, which I adore--and has an Owen voice that it is so true and so perfect I feel like Chad Harbach must be my Yuletide gift-giver. The story captures what I love so much about the characters and their friendships, deftly interweaving the past of the novel with the future of the story and introducing new characters that make the world even richer. I was sad when I got to the end of the book, because I just wanted it to go on and on. My Yuletide story brings "what happened next" magically to life in the most satisfying way I can imagine. If you liked the book, you don't want to miss this story. Highly recommended.

Yesterday was my last day in the office until 2013. Yay! So I would like to celebrate by writing some snippets. And I would love some prompts. Can be holiday related or not. I'm open to any fandom I've written before or any canon I'm familiar with. This includes (not an exhaustive list): Teen Wolf, Haven, Avengers, Inception, Revenge, Person of Interest, Adam fandom, Castle, Smallville, SGA, Firefly, Fringe, Master & Commander, Star Trek, Supernatural, and Veronica Mars.

Comment with a fandom, pairing, and a short prompt. I will write some snippets.

Come play!
